result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob Patrick Mellgren

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:58 PM Defendant Jacob Patrick Mellgren in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Jacob Patrick Mellgren.  Attorney Lawrence Lasee in court for State of Wisconsin.   Atty. Risseeuw rec'd discovery but has not rec'd offer.  Deft. in sober living facility for 6 months - 1 year.
Status Conference scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Information to be filed tracking complaint.  Defense enters NOT GUILTY to each count.

10:28 AM Defendant Jacob Patrick Mellgren appeared by phone and waives his right to appearing in person.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw appeared by phone for Jacob Patrick Mellgren.  Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. PQW received/reviewed by Court. Court finds waiver to be made freely and voluntarily. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and is bound over to the circuit court. Present bond cont'd.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Response/reply from to Document #12 re:  remote appearance
to Appear Remotely for PH scheduled on 8/30/2022 @ 10:30am
Letter to Court re:  Adjournment of PH
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Phone call from Atty Risseeuw and Debbie/DA's office - rescheduled PH that was set on 8/9/2022 at 1pm to 8/30/2022 at 10:30am. This was rescheduled due to COVID. I informed Atty Risseeuw that we are requiring a doctor's excuse.
Preliminary hearing on August 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Phone call from Atty Risseeuw and Jordan/DA's office - scheduled PH 8/9/2022 at 1pm, the CIA that was set on 7/14/2022 at 9am has been canceled.

1:26 PM Defendant Jacob Patrick Mellgren appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Spansail for SPD appeared by video. Def given complaint, advised of charges, and advised of right to counsel/SPD.  Bond is set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
